comments:
Build: 20020404

1. New Java Project.
2. New Java file named Test.java
3. In the Java editor hit Ctrl-l (Goto line)

You should get the following exception:

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.ui.texteditor.GotoLineAction.run(GotoLineAction.java:149)
	at
org.eclipse.ui.texteditor.RetargetTextEditorAction.run(RetargetTextEditorAction.java:110)

sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)

Real problem:

I had switched to emacs key binding and back again.  I think both copies of the
actions find next, find previous, incremental find and goto line were put into
the edit menu.

To test this, first switch to emacs key bindings in the workspace preferences,
and then switch back to the default key bindings.  Then look in the edit menu.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 12830 ***
